Math Monday

The Math Monday undergraduate lecture series is the flagship event of MUSA. It is a series of talks, every Monday at 5 PM, given by professors and other academics about mathematical research and special topics.

To Infinity and Beyond — The strange world of ordinal arithmetic

Speaker: Professor Richard E. Borcherds

Date and Room: 11 September, 2017 in 740 Evans

Abstract: Beyond the usual numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, ..., lie Cantor's countable ordinal numbers ω, ω+1, ..., ω+ω, ..., ε0, .... In some way their arithmetic is similar to the natural numbers; one can add, multiply and raise them to powers and define primes and so on. However in other ways their arithmetic looks a little strange; for example, 1+ω < ω+1.

MUSA is a Registered Student Organization acting independently of the University of California.
